The Code set out CARDINAL principal appellate remedies , called “ appellate measures ” : an appeal , which , under Articles CARDINAL et seq . , could be brought solely against judgments and an interlocutory appeal which , under Articles CARDINAL et seq . , could be brought against decisions other than judgments and against orders for preventive measures . There was ( and still is ) no specific provision expressly providing for remedies against inactivity on the part of the judiciary in the course of criminal proceedings .
